solution_line_template: If Tina's pail holds {tina_pail_capacity} gallons and Tommy's holds {tommy_more_than_tina} more gallons than hers, that means Tommy's holds {tina_pail_capacity}+{tommy_more_than_tina}=<<{tina_pail_capacity}+{tommy_more_than_tina}={tommy_pail_capacity}>>{tommy_pail_capacity} gallons.

If Timmy's pail holds twice as much as Tommy's {tommy_pail_capacity}-gallon pail, that means it holds {tommy_pail_capacity}*{timmy_multiplier}=<<{tommy_pail_capacity}*{timmy_multiplier}={timmy_pail_capacity}>>{timmy_pail_capacity} gallons.

Therefore, in 1 trip that means all three move a total of {tina_pail_capacity}+{tommy_pail_capacity}+{timmy_pail_capacity}=<<{tina_pail_capacity}+{tommy_pail_capacity}+{timmy_pail_capacity}={gallons_per_trip}>>{gallons_per_trip} gallons.
In three trips, that means they would move a total of {gallons_per_trip}*{num_trips}=<<{gallons_per_trip}*{num_trips}={total_gallons}>>{total_gallons} gallons
